author: barnabemonnot
content: the same backlog would be absorbed in equal amount of time should basefee be more stable: in the present case it's true that there is this oscillation phenomenon where you get a full block, then an empty block, then a full block etc., but it would take as long to clear the backlog if you had a series of half full blocks instead

author: barnabemonnot
content: (by backlog I mean what I think you mean: during a spike there is a bunch of transactions that declare high fees to capture whatever opportunity there is during the spike, e.g. nft drop, and they are included late so they just exist in a pending state past the point where the spike is over)
